identificationModule.briefTitle: The Use of Ranolazine for Atrial Fibrillation and Diastolic Heart Failure
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo Controlled Study, Designed to Investigate the Effect of Ranolazine on Left Ventricular Diastolic Function in Patients With Symptomatic AF and Preserved Ejection Function, After the Subject Has Undergone a Successful External Electrical Cardioversion

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of ranolazine in the prevention of recurrent atrial fibrillation in post-cardioversion patients with heart failure and preserved ejection fraction.

interventions.name: Ranolazine
interventions.description: Patients will take ranolazine 1000 mg tablets twice daily

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Placebo pill manufactured to mimic ranolazine 1000 mg tablets. Patients will be instructed to take two pills a day.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Time to First Atrial Fibrillation (AF) Recurrence
primaryOutcomes.description: There were too few participants for an assessment of time to first recurrence, therefore the numbers of participants with recurrence up to 6 months is reported instead

groups.title: Ranolazine
groups.description: Ranolazine: Patients will take ranolazine 1000 mg tablets twice daily

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: Placebo: Placebo pill manufactured to mimic ranolazine 1000 mg tablets. Patients will be instructed to take two pills a day.

achievements.comment: Study was stopped early because of difficulty recruiting.
